conclusion: Initial direction and speed of the car moving from lower right towards blocks with moderate speed.
Collision dynamics involve transfer of kinetic energy and deflection of car's path.
Blocks are arranged in a semi-circular pattern affecting car's collision sequence.
Car is moving towards the group of blocks from the lower right.
First block to collide with is the red block at the bottom right of the arrangement.
Upon hitting the red block, car transfers kinetic energy causing block to move and deflects car's path upwards and slightly to the left.
After deflection by red block, car moves towards green block directly above and collides.
Car may hit blue block above green block after collision with green block.
Car's speed reduces with each collision and direction changes.
Car will eventually stop near the center of block arrangement or between blocks due to loss of kinetic energy.
Final answer: Car will collide with red block first, then green block, possibly blue block, and stop near center or between blocks.
